resources.string: autoevalueit iorself
C[orporate] R[elatelated] A[utoevaluation] P[roject]
Operating Systems
Databases
Networking
Sap Environment
Level 1 – Basic
Level 2 - Intermediate
Level 3 - Advanced
Level 4 - Expert
Basic theoretical knowledge of networking (knowing the main networking components and protocols)
Understand how SAP Systems communicate over the network
Know SAP internal communication ports
Theoretical understanding of SAP secure communications
Capability to cooperate with network experts in solving networking issues
Knows the network concepts that facilitate communication between SAP systems and other applications (interfacing with other non-SAP applications)
Basic knowledge of SAP network security (gateway security, certificate, SNC….)
Awareness regarding the dependencies between different SAP communication channels (how will a component failure affect the entire SAP ecosystem)
Provides specialized technical guidance on complex architecture challenges
Able to analyze existing network structure in order to define, design and achieve simplified, application- focused network architectures (finding bottlenecks, network tuning etc.)
User concepts knowledge
File structure knowledge (content, permissions, navigation commands)
Being able to execute basic operating commands (familiar with terminal command lines)
Basic script understanding
Editing configuration files
Creating shares / Mounting
Basic OS performance management (identifying situations where resources are over-used – memory/CPU/disk)
Ability to install / activate additional OS components (Windows additional features, Unix packages)
User and Groups Management (handling user policies in relation with network domains etc.)
File system creation/administration
Troubleshooting OS errors
Basic script creation
Advanced OS System Structure knowledge:Peripheral Management; Memory Management; Filesystem Management; Application Management
Patching OS according to SAP requirements
Use high availability OS environments
Advanced script creation and troubleshooting
Understanding how SAP components make use of low-level OS functionality (why are certain libraries, function calls etc. being called by SAP components)
Design and implement high availability OS environments
Theoretical knowledge of database systems
Starting and stopping databases
Identify DB processes and file structure at OS level
Space management (tablespace extension)
Able to locate and interpret DB logs
Basic SQL knowledge (DB queries)
Space management (modify file structure)
Patching/upgrading following procedure
Perform backup/restore/recovery following procedure
Understand RDBMS logging mechanism
Working with database specific tools (BRtools, HANA Studio, Sybase SCC, MaxDB Studio,etc)
Perform certain database- related task based on a given documentation
Understanding database memory areas
Change database parameters
Understand and implement benchmark on database servers
Perform and troubleshoot backup/restore/recovery
Patching/upgrading Databases and troubleshooting
Database reorganization/compression
Installing and configuring Databases
Perform database migration
Optimize database performance
Database sizing in implementation projects
Interpret benchmark on database servers (EWA, HANA mini checks, etc)
Implementing high database availability architecture based on specific procedure
Designing and configuring high database availability architecture
Able to troubleshoot database upgrades/migration issues
Advanced backup techniques including backup strategy definition
Define and implement the database operating and administrative procedures
Evaluate performance and anticipate data bottleneck
Find and implement means to automate manual processes
Conduct comprehensive Benchmark on database servers
General knowledge about SAP Netweaver
Knowledge of SAP administration transaction codes
Able to navigate in non-ABAP Systems (administration tools)
Able to perform independently SAP-related tasks based on a given documentation
Starting and stopping SAP systems
Theoretical knowledge and basic skills in: Printer, User and TMS Management
Upgrading SAP kernel
Maintenance of SAP standard administration background jobs
Perform SAP client administration (create client, copy client, delete client, export/import client) as required
Troubleshooting and advanced set-up in Printer, User and TMS Management
Configure and troubleshoot SAP system connections
Perform homogenous system copies
Follow-up EarlyWatch reports and implement recommendations
Installing and configuring SAP Systems based on a step by step documentation
Managed system configuration
Perform Root Cause Analysis
Performing SP stack upgrades
Perform heterogeneous system copies
SAP System sizing and design in new implementations
Installing and configuring SAP Systems from scratch based on customer needs
SAP system performance tuning
Able to define and implement Security concepts based on SAP recommendations
Performing EHP stack and release upgrades
Solution Manager scenario configuration
Design and maintain the technical system landscape of the SAP systems, including high availability solutions
Independently lead or execute complex assignments and deliverables
Solve complex performance issues
Full lifecycle implementation for an SAP system
Proven hands-on experience on implementing SAP security concepts
